inference:
The sum of the interior angles of any triangle is 180 degrees. So, 

$$2x^\circ+3x^\circ+90^\circ=180^\circ$$

$$5x^\circ=90^\circ$$

$$x^\circ=\boxed{18^\circ}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{18^\circ}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The angles $2x^{\circ}$ and $3x^{\circ}$ shown are complementary and thus add to $90^{\circ}.$ Therefore, $2x+3x=90$ or $5x=90$ and so $x=\frac{90}{5}=\boxed{18}.$
